as the one all together lovely and the

this self-satisfied judean often dared

he really entertained the notion that

it required tact ability and patience as

of such an idealist as jesus to say

a far-seen and able financier and he was

a learned man
a loyal though sometimes critical

the apostles loved judas he was really

he must have believed in jesus but we

there is a way that seems right to a man

to the path of sin and death be assured

judas was an only son of unwise parents
when very young he was pampered and
petted
he was a spoiled child as he grew up he
had exaggerated ideas about his
self-importance
he was a poor loser he had loose and
distorted ideas about fairness
he was given to the indulgence of hate

all through his life judas had
cultivated the habit of getting even
with those whom he fancied and

his sense of values and loyalties were
defective
to jesus judas was a faith adventure
from the beginning the master fully

and well knew the dangers of admitting

but it is the nature of the sons of god
to give every created being a
full and equal chance for salvation and

jesus wanted not only the mortals of

when doubts exist as to the sincerity

it is the invariable practice of the

the door of eternal life is wide open to
all whosoever will
may come there are no restrictions or

save the faith of the one who comes this

always doing everything possible to

confused apostle
but when light is not honestly received
and lived up to
it tends to become darkness within the

kingdom
but he did not make progress in the

he failed to make satisfactory personal

judas became increasingly a brooder over

and finally he became a victim of

and he grew abnormally suspicious of his

presently he became obsessed with the

anything to avenge himself yes even

but these wicked and dangerous ideas did

it seemed wasteful to judas and when his

right there in the hearing of all it was

and he made up his mind to get even with
he knew not whom
but he crystallized all the evil whose
nature upon the one innocent person
in all the sordid drama of his

episode
which marked his passing from the
progressive kingdom of light
into that self-chosen domain of darkness
the master many times both privately and

jesus did everything possible consistent

to prevent judas choosing to go the

failed
he yielded to the sour and sordid

judas then entered into the base in

conceived plans of traitors betrayal
he experienced moments of regret and

when the sordid and sinful business was

rushed out and committed the final act
the drama of fleeing from the realities

suicide the eleven apostles were
